trans-unit.source: API Key: Required for sending messages
Debug: If activated no SMS will be sent or calculated
Delay: Delay dispatch. Expects an UNIX timestamp or date string with the format format yyyy-mm-dd hh:ii
Details: Shows numerous details to the sent Handy for debugging
Foreign ID: Custom ID to return back in DLR callbacks etc. Max. 64 chars, allowed characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, .-_@
Flash: If enabled, SMS are displayed directly in the receiverâ€™s display
From: Set a custom sender identifier
JSON: The output is more detailed in JSON format
Label: Custom string for internal use. Allowed characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, .-_@
No Reload: Disable prevention of sending the same SMS (text, type and recipient alike) within 180 seconds
Performance Tracking: Track URLs found in the message text.
Return Message ID: If this parameter is set, the ID of the SMS is output in the second line after the status code
Time To Live: Specifies the validity period of the SMS in milliseconds
User Data Header: If specified and parameter "text" contains hexcode, the message will be sent as 8-bit binary
Unicode: Force transmission as unicode reducing the SMS length to 70 chars
UTF-8: Forces the detection as a UTF8 character set and overrides automatic recognition of the API
